replies.body: I was very happy when I heard the news, however my entire Twitter timeline was not. I live in Texas, and there are a lot of very religious people here. A lot of people were hating on some friends that I have for being gay, which I see to be very unnecessary. I am a religious person as well, however I haven't been to church in over a year. I even saw a tweet saying that "6/26 is our new 9/11", which I found to be absolutely disgusting, since that day was a very happy day for all the lgbt community while 9/11 was a terrorist attack that cost thousands of lives. I respect others opinions, but I don't see it necessary to pick on the lgbt community. Anyways, at least our country has done something I agree with(:

A lot of people were hating on some friends that I have for being gay, which I see to be very unnecessary. I am a religious person as well, however I haven't been to church in over a year. I even saw a tweet saying that "6/26 is our new 9/11", which I found to be absolutely disgusting, since that day was a very happy day for all the lgbt community while 9/11 was a terrorist attack that cost thousands of lives. I respect others opinions, but I don't see it necessary to pick on the lgbt community. Anyways, at least our country has done something I agree with(:

replies.body:
I was raised in a house where change is good, but also hard to adjust to. In my opinion stuff can come in many shapes and sizes. For example, there are different types of energy, and different types of cultures.

Some of us accepted the nature of drug use, drinking, prostitution, murder etc... And I'm NOT saying that we allow this here and don't try to prevent them.

 But what I don't understand is, why some people can't accept the fact that love can come in many colors. 

Now I do understand that religion, and some of our societies beliefs prevent us from seeing what others do. And again I'm NOT trying to rewrite religion nor am I trying to change the rules, and I completely understand that your religion/family/rules come first. 

This person (Unknown) said this and I quote 

"We all bleed red, all taste rain, all fall down, lose our way, 

We all say words we regret, we all cry tears we all bleed red, 
Sometimes were strong, sometimes were weak; sometimes were hurt
It cuts deep; we live this life breath to breath; were all the same
WE ALL BLEED RED"


This is just MY OPINION, and honestly I'm happy that men and women can express their love here in America.

I'm with you.

I'm a catholic too, But I don't see the point of having people hating on love, because it's just love. In my opinion, A woman that loves a man is the same to a woman that loves a woman or a man that loves a man. People can't just fight against love, as you well said before, because, in the end, if you love someone truly, no-one can stop you. I also want to point out that i'm really pissed off with Twitt's like 6/26 is the new 9/11, As Refuse said before. People are always saying that differences between Men and Woman has ended, that we're living on the 21st Century, and the difference between sexes, In all ways, is better nowadays. To me, This seems similar to the racial problems today, because not letting 2 people that love each other is a bit of downgrading those people, as it used to happen with Slaves on earlier centuries.


I'd like to point out that we are all the same in the end, we mite look different, sound different, smell different, but in the end we are all humans, and we should all be treated the same way. You just can't treat better someone that is rich to someone that is poor just because of the money, and the same thing happens with this.

Obama said that it was a really good improvement to the U.S, which really is, it's just that the people that downgrade homosexual couples just because they love someone of the same sex, shouldn't live. That's all I have got to say about that.

The point is that people say that slavity and downgrading of people is now finished, but it clearly isn't. Just with one comment of one person saying that homosexual couples should die or shouldn't be allowed, should go to hell.

Yea, TFP...

replies.body:
Where do I start....
These people are no different to you and me, they are average human beings who have opinions, friends and family. The one thing that is different is that they love different people. Why the hell should that matter? People discriminate against these people when they walk freely around the face of the Earth like you, me and all of the supporters and haters.
Plus, don't even get started on how they can't reproduce, around 7,120,000,000 people live on the Earth. This number is increasing rapidly, it's not like we as human beings are endangered, so why should some people not wanting to produce children be any problem? Straight married couples can marry and never have kids and have no grief over it whatsoever.
Some citizens of America, the land of freedom and opportunity, are now becoming as bad as those of North Korea, who have the strictest censorship in the world.
Saying that some people can't have happy lives because you don't like it is bullshit. It intrudes on their personal rights and can make the people sad for the rest of their lives.
Also, don't start saying that you don't like the way that these people reproduce, because no-one is forcing you to do it or even to watch it, but you are forcing them to stop? Bullshit.
For now, I will not go into the biblical aspects, I personally, do not believe in any kind of a God, but I have a feeling that this is not the place to post my beliefs.
So stop intruding on these people's rights, if you don't like it, go to somewhere where you won't see a happy couple walking down the street together, like millions are across the world.

replies.body:
I dont mean to start a flame war or some shit but... "Just with one comment of one person saying that homosexual couples should die or shouldn't be allowed, should go to hell."

Now, Im not a religious person of any matter, and I had to look this up on wikipedia because I cant be bothered to actually READ the bible. But this quote is from the bible.

"If a man lies with a male as with a woman, both of them have committed an abomination; they shall surely be put to death"

So, what you said above implying that people that think that homosexual couples shouldn't be allowed and then saying for those saying those things for them to go to hell, wouldn't the quote I took from the bible be a good counter-argument to your point? Because as far as Im aware, the idea of a "hell" is a christian idea and term. So it seems counter-intuitive to say that something that is said many times in the bible that it's NOT allowed is ok, then say that the people which follow the bible by what it says for them to go to hell for following what the bible says?

replies.body:
This whole argument of
"Protect our religious freedom don't allow same sex marriage!!111" 
is plain stupid. Your "freedom" is depriving other individuals of their "freedom" to get married. A lot of people don't know marriage carries much more responsibilities / privileges then it sounds. Here's a list. (Taken from wiki)
  • Right to benefits while married:
    • Employment assistance and transitional services for spouses of members being separated from military service; continued commissary privileges
    • Per diem payment to spouse for federal civil service employees when relocating
    • Indian Health Service care for spouses of Native Americans (in some circumstances)
    • Sponsor husband/wife for immigration benefits
  • Larger benefits under some programs if married, including:
    • Veteran's disability
    • Supplemental Security Income
    • Disability payments for federal employees
    • Medicaid
    • Property tax exemption for homes of totally disabled veterans
    • Income tax deductions, credits, rates exemption, and estimates
    • Wages of an employee working for one's spouse are exempt from federal unemployment tax[3]
  • Joint and family-related rights:
    • Joint filing of bankruptcy permitted
    • Joint parenting rights, such as access to children's school records
    • Family visitation rights for the spouse and non-biological children, such as to visit a spouse in a hospital or prison
    • Next-of-kin status for emergency medical decisions or filing wrongful death claims
    • Custodial rights to children, shared property, child support, and alimony after divorce
    • Domestic violence intervention
    • Access to "family only" services, such as reduced rate memberships to clubs & organizations or residency in certain neighborhoods
  • Preferential hiring for spouses of veterans in government jobs
  • Tax-free transfer of property between spouses (including on death) and exemption from "due-on-sale" clauses.
  • Special consideration to spouses of citizens and resident aliens
  • Threats against spouses of various federal employees is a federal crime
  • Right to continue living on land purchased from spouse by National Park Service when easement granted to spouse
  • Court notice of probate proceedings
  • Domestic violence protection orders
  • Existing homestead lease continuation of rights
  • Regulation of condominium sales to owner-occupants exemption
  • Funeral and bereavement leave
  • Joint adoption and foster care
  • Joint tax filing
  • Insurance licenses, coverage, eligibility, and benefits organization of mutual benefits society
  • Legal status with stepchildren
  • Making spousal medical decisions
  • Spousal non-resident tuition deferential waiver
  • Permission to make funeral arrangements for a deceased spouse, including burial or cremation
  • Right of survivorship of custodial trust
  • Right to change surname upon marriage
  • Right to enter into prenuptial agreement
  • Right to inheritance of property
  • Spousal privilege in court cases (the marital confidences privilege and the spousal testimonial privilege)
  • For those divorced or widowed, the right to many of ex- or late spouse's benefits, including:
    Social Security pension
    Veteran's pensions, indemnity compensation for service-connected deaths, medical care, and nursing home care, right to burial in veterans' cemeteries, educational assistance, and housing
    survivor benefits for federal employees
    Survivor benefits for spouses of longshoremen, harbor workers, railroad workers
    Additional benefits to spouses of coal miners who die of black lung disease
    $100,000 to spouse of any public safety officer killed in the line of duty
    Continuation of employer-sponsored health benefits
    Renewal and termination rights to spouse's copyrights on death of spouse
    Continued water rights of spouse in some circumstances
    Payment of wages and workers compensation benefits after worker death
    Making, revoking, and objecting to post-mortem anatomical gifts
    Yeah Ok, so if you wanna deprive same sex couples of all these privileges because "You don't agree with it because in the bible it says this this and this" Yeah I respect Christianity and the bible, but same sex marriage will (probably) never be recognised by the church, but by the government. So let these guys do whatever the hell they want, it's not going to affect heterosexual marriage it's not like dicks are gonna come flying in your face.
